Hello,

> First, I'd also like to congratulate you and your co-authors on this
> interesting paper.

Thank you.

> My question is about the second objective, which I initially thought it
> was
> a connection cost, but as I read in Section 4(j):
>
> "The second objective prioritizes individuals that are far away from other
> individuals already discovered by the algorithm, where distance is
> measured
> in a Cartesian space with connection costs on the x-axis and modularity on
> the y-axis".

This section is about the MOLE algorithm, which is used to generate the
map (fig 3). In the "simulation", the second objective is the connection
cost (the first one is the task performance).


Best regards,
-- JBM
